bridgeStub().details: Stub method for future bridging functionality This is a placeholder that will be implemented in future versions

bridgeWithPermit((uint256,uint32,uint32,.details: Bridge tokens using permit for approval

params.params: Bridge parameters containing:   - amount: Amount of tokens to bridge (32 bytes)   - destinationDomain: Target domain ID (4 bytes)   - minFinalityThreshold: Minimum finality threshold (4 bytes)   - maxFee: Maximum fee allowed (32 bytes)   - fee: Fee amount (32 bytes)   - burnToken: Token address to burn (20 bytes)   - feeRecipient: Address to receive fees (20 bytes)   - mintRecipient: Recipient address on destination chain (32 bytes)   - destinationCaller: Caller address on destination chain (32 bytes)   - feeIsBips: Whether fee is in basis points (1 byte)
params.permitParams: Permit parameters containing:   - deadline: Expiration timestamp for permit (32 bytes)   - v: Signature recovery value (1 byte)   - r: First 32 bytes of signature (32 bytes)   - s: Last 32 bytes of signature (32 bytes)

params.params: Bridge parameters containing:   - amount: Amount of tokens to bridge (32 bytes)   - destinationDomain: Target domain ID (4 bytes)   - minFinalityThreshold: Minimum finality threshold (4 bytes)   - maxFee: Maximum fee allowed (32 bytes)   - fee: Fee amount (32 bytes)   - burnToken: Token address to burn (20 bytes)   - feeRecipient: Address to receive fees (20 bytes)   - mintRecipient: Recipient address on destination chain (32 bytes)   - destinationCaller: Caller address on destination chain (32 bytes)   - feeIsBips: Whether fee is in basis points (1 byte)

calculateFees(uint256,uint256,bool).details: Calculates the developer and protocol shares for a given amount and fee.

params.amount: The base amount to calculate fees from (in token's smallest unit)
params.fee: The fee amount or basis points (absolute or bips)
params.feeIsBips: Whether the fee is in basis points (true) or absolute amount (false)

returns.developerShare: The amount that goes to the developer (in token's smallest unit)
returns.protocolShare: The amount that goes to the protocol (in token's smallest unit)

getProtocolFee(uint256).details: Returns the protocol fee for a given developer fee.

params.developerFee: The developer fee amount (in token's smallest unit)

returns.protocolFee: The protocol's share (in token's smallest unit)

getProtocolFeeConfig().details: Returns the current protocol fee configuration.

returns.protocolFeeShare: Protocol fee share in basis points (0-10000)
returns.protocolWallet: Address where protocol fees are sent

initialize(address,address).details: Initialize the contract (replaces constructor for upgradeable contracts)

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setProtocolFeeConfig(uint256,address).details: Sets all protocol fee configuration parameters at once. Only callable by the contract owner.

params.bips: The protocol fee share in basis points (0-10000).
params.wallet: The address to receive protocol fees.

setProtocolFeeShare(uint256).details: Sets the protocol fee share in basis points (0-10000, where 10000 = 100%). Only callable by the contract owner.

params.bips: The new protocol fee share in basis points.

setProtocolFeeWallet(address).details: Sets the protocol fee wallet address. Only callable by the contract owner.

params.wallet: The address to receive protocol fees.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

version().details: Get the version of this contract implementation
